description: The attack, coming more than eight months into a grinding war that shows few signs of ending soon, was likely to fuel new calls by Israeli protesters for a cease-fire.
title: 8 Israeli soldiers killed in Gaza in deadliest attack on Israeli forces in months

description: A new podcast from LAist Studios and the NPR Network explores how events that played out decades ago shape AAPI families today.
title: 'Inheriting' podcast explores how historic events shape AAPI families

description: Catherine, Princess of Wales, has said she had a few more months left in her chemotherapy treatment and she i making "good progress."
title: Back in the public eye, Princess Kate attends first royal event after cancer diagnosis

description: African giant pouched rats use their acute sense of smell to sniff out landmines and detect TB in sputum samples. Now, they are set to become search-and-rescue specialists too.
title: Dear rat, did you ever know that you're my hero?

description: 16 year-old Barcelona soccer player Lamine Yamal brought his homework with him to Euro 2024.
title: 16-year-old soccer player Lamine Yamal brings his homework to Euro 2024

description: A round up of this week's developments and drama in artificial intelligence: Apple announced a slew of AI features for its new iPhone and Elon Musk dropped his lawsuit against the maker of ChatGPT.
title: The week in AI: Apple announces AI features in new iPhone, Musk drops OpenAI lawsuit

description: More cattle are getting the bird flu virus, and it appears that people are a big factor in spreading it from herd-to-herd. NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben talks to NPR Health correspondent Will Stone.
title: Bird flu risk is restricted to those who work with dairy cattle — for now

description: Researchers are studying why there's a dearth of black sperm donors and how to increase the numbers. (This story first aired on Morning Edition on June 13, 2024.)
title: The lack of Black sperm donors is a nationwide problem

description: A high-profile politician is shaking up the U.K.'s parliamentary race: Nigel Farage.
title: Known for his role in Brexit, Nigel Farage is gaining prominence in the U.K. elections

description: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben and Meadowlark Media 's Howard Bryant discuss the NBA Finals and remember "The Logo".
title: Saturday Sports: NBA finals, Caitlin Clark and internet trolls, Jerry West passing

description: Dozens of leaders, including VP Kamala Harris, attend a Ukraine Peace Summit in Switzerland this weekend. Russia is not invited, but might this meeting still hold promise for the war's end?
title: Switzerland is hosting a summit organized by Ukraine in the hope of peace talks

description: The US Supreme Court ruled this week in favor of Starbucks in a case involving employees trying to unionize. What are the implications for companies and the labor movement?
title: The Supreme Court's ruling in favor of Starbucks could impact unions everywhere

description: NPR’s Danielle Kurtzleben speaks to reporter Jorge Valencia about banana brand Chiquita being found liable in US courts for deaths during the Colombian Civil War and the terror group it funded.
title: Why banana brand Chiquita was found liable for deaths in the Colombia's Civil War

description: Home and auto insurance premiums have been rising at double-digit rates.  That's prompting even the most loyal insurance customers to shop around for better deals.
title: Soaring insurance rates send more people shopping for deals

description: Neuroscientists say the pleasure response helps us survive as a species. So why do we feel embarrassed by some of the things we love the most?
title: From ‘romantasy’ to reality TV, why we love guilty pleasures so much

description: Brexit was supposed to give Britain a handle on immigration, according to its boosters. But as the government still struggles with migration across the English Channel,
title: Immigration is a big issue ahead of the U.K. elections, too

description: Advances in medicine mean more people are living longer with HIV. But aging with HIV comes with increased health risks, and this growing population needs specialized care that's hard to find.
title: People with HIV are aging, and the challenges are piling up

description: NPR's Brian Mann explored one of the easy trails in the Linville Gorge Wilderness in North Carolina
title: Hiking North Carolina's Linville Gorge Wilderness area

description: The media site founded by adherents of Falun Gong morphed into a pro-Trump outlet that spouted conspiracy theories. Now the CEO is out after money laundering charges were filed against the CFO.
title: Money laundering charges raise questions about the direction of The Epoch Times

description: Morning Edition caught up with NPR’s John Ruwitch, who has covered China for decades. Here’s our conversation. fa
title: We spent a week in China. Here’s what we learned about our global rival

description: A French historian recently made a case for a 1900 silver medal to be credited to France, based on the Olympics' informal rules in that era. The cyclist, Lloyd Hildebrand, lived most of his life in France.
title: Olympics reassigns a 1900 medal -- and its winner -- from Britain to France

description: Contamination levels in the first eight days of June, after persistent heavy rain in Paris, showed bacteria such as E. coli and enterococci beyond limits judged safe for athletes.
title: Unsafe E. coli levels found in Paris' Seine River less than 2 months before Olympics
